=

Mr. nicemaletrust posts hundreds of messages, but they get stopped before =
they hit the list, he gets deleted and he rejoins under a new but similar u=
ser name. I've come to admire "his" persistence, although he's probably a b=
oiler room somewhere rather than an individual.

I'm afraid that Gordon may=
 be waving his cane and yelling at the kids to stay off his lawn before lon=
g...

I had a chance to look at a very interesting tsuba recently. It's a t=
ypical bird in the plum tree Higo guard, but what's interesting is that it =
wasn't completed. The design is scribed into the plate and all of the rough=
ing out was done with a chisel. Even the outline of the rim is chiseled in =
with multiple cuts from both sides. It looks like a slight gouge was used w=
hile cutting the rim and most of the sukashi was cut with a straight chisel=
.

A couple of sections of sukashi have some file work done, but the rest i=
s still rough. It looks like one of the thin branches was chiseled down too=
 thin to be finished properly and the piece was abandoned. The color of the=
 guard isn't bad (even though I doubt any patina was applied) and the build=
 up on the interior sukashi walls looks about like you'd expect for an Edo =
piece.

I recently spent two weeks shooting in Baja Sur, Mexico. A great pl=
ace, other than the developed Cabo area on the southern tip. 

A few wildli=
fe photos from both the Pacific and Gulf sides:

http://www.flickr.com/phot=
os/jggilbert/sets/72157623839030000/

Jim
